preparation.title: Pre-Expedition Preparation
preparation.warning_text: Use reef-safe sunscreen only (oxybenzone and octinoxate free). Regular sunscreen damages coral reefs.
preparation.air_reserve: Never use all your air - maintain reserve
preparation.safety_stop: Always perform 3-5 minute safety stop at 5m

culture_laws.title: Culture & Local Laws
culture_laws.dress_resorts: Resorts & Tourist Areas: Casual western clothing is acceptable
culture_laws.dress_local_islands: Local Islands: Conservative dress recommended - cover shoulders and knees, especially in male-dominated areas
culture_laws.dress_mosques: Mosques: Remove shoes, women should cover head, shoulders and knees
culture_laws.behavior_locals: Show respect to locals - avoid pointing, remove hat indoors, greet with 'Assalam alaikum'
culture_laws.behavior_photography: Never photograph people without permission - always ask first
culture_laws.behavior_customs: Be aware of prayer times - avoid loud activities, restaurants may close during prayer
culture_laws.alcohol_public: Alcohol is prohibited in public - not available on local islands
culture_laws.alcohol_resorts: Alcohol is available only at resorts and tourist establishments
culture_laws.alcohol_possession: Do not carry alcohol from resorts to public areas
culture_laws.photography_underwater: Underwater photography: Use responsible techniques, avoid touching corals and marine life
culture_laws.photography_close: Close-up photography: Maintain distance from marine creatures - use zoom instead of moving closer
culture_laws.photography_coral: Never stand on or touch coral - use reef-safe practices only

emergency.title: Emergency Hub
emergency.accident_step1: Stop diving immediately and alert your dive buddy
emergency.accident_step2: Swim calmly to surface - perform safety stop if possible
emergency.accident_step3: Exit water carefully, lay victim flat if breathing issues
emergency.accident_step4: Call emergency services immediately (119 or alerting dive center)
emergency.accident_step5: Do not remove equipment until medical assessment
emergency.chamber_male: Male City Hospital (Indira Gandhi Memorial Hospital) - equipped with recompression facilities
emergency.chamber_hulhumale: Hulhumale Medical Facilities - backup hyperbaric chamber
emergency.chamber_resorts: Some larger resorts have basic recompression protocols, but Male City is primary
emergency.evacuation_info: For life-threatening diving emergencies, helicopter evacuation to Male can be arranged through resort or emergency services
emergency.embassy_info: There is no embassy in Maldives. Nearest: Indian Embassy or contact foreign affairs ministry. Keep your country's emergency numbers in phone.
emergency.insurance_deco: Ensure your dive insurance covers decompression sickness and evacuation
emergency.insurance_claim: Contact insurance provider immediately after incident with incident report
emergency.keep_card: Keep this card in your dive kit at all times

quick_guide.title: Quick Guide Cheat Sheet
quick_guide.sharks_safe: Sharks: Generally safe - maintain distance, don't touch, back away calmly if approaching
quick_guide.sea_snakes: Sea Snakes: AVOID - highly venomous, stay away completely
quick_guide.stingrays: Stingrays: Safe if undisturbed - shuffle feet when entering water to scare away
quick_guide.sea_urchins: Sea Urchins: Sharp spines - wear reef shoes, avoid stepping on them
quick_guide.coral: Coral: Don't touch - causes injury to you and damage to coral
quick_guide.eels: Moray Eels: Generally shy - don't poke into crevices
quick_guide.tip_buddy: Stay with your buddy at all times
quick_guide.tip_air: Monitor air consumption - turn back at 1/3 air
quick_guide.tip_current: If caught in current, swim perpendicular or signal for help
quick_guide.dry_season: Dry Season (Nov-Apr): Best visibility, calm seas, moderate rainfall
quick_guide.wet_season: Wet Season (May-Oct): Higher rainfall, stronger currents, but warmer water

essential_info.title: Essential Information
essential_info.visa_tourist: Tourist visas: 30 days visa-on-arrival for most nationalities
